thag8.3:1.1_0: When I’ve learned the first time,
thag8.3:1.2_0: who fears nothing from any quarter,
thag8.3:1.3_0: I was struck with a sense of urgency,
thag8.3:2.1_0: Anyone who, having found such a Teacher,
thag8.3:2.3_0: is like someone who, when Lucky Luck comes to them,
thag8.3:2.4_0: would drive her away with their hands and feet.
thag8.3:3.1_0: Then I left behind my children and wives,
thag8.3:3.3_0: I had my hair and beard cut off,
thag8.3:3.4_0: and then I went forth to homelessness.
thag8.3:4.1_0: Endowed with the monastic training and livelihood,
thag8.3:5.1_0: Then a wish occurred to me,
thag8.3:5.3_0: I wouldn’t sit down, not even for a moment,
thag8.3:5.4_0: until the dart of craving was pulled out.
thag8.3:7.1_0: and I knew my past lives,
thag8.3:8.1_0: At the end of the night,
thag8.3:8.2_0: as the rising of the sun drew near,
thag8.3:8.4_0: When he had crossed over, he sat cross-legged.”
thag8.3:8.7_0: The Book of the Eights is finished.
